titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Hugo Kauder Papers 1927-1946

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Kauder, Hugo. Papers

address.addressline: Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: Hugo Kauder, composer, musician. The Hugo Kauder Papers and Addenda includes records, holograph manuscript scores, reproduced manuscript scores, and published scores. Many of the scores reproduced by blueprint process bear holograph revisions or dynamic markings in pen or pencil, and a number of scores are inscribed to Edward E. Lowinsky and his family. This collection has been assigned Codex Manuscript #1399.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Audio recordings in Series I are restricted due to the need for special equipment.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: When quoting material from this collection, the preferred citation is: Kauder, Hugo. Papers [Box #, Folder #], Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center, University of Chicago Library

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Hugo Kauder (1888–1972) was an Austrian and American composer and musical pedagogue. A self-taught musician, Kauder's chamber music compositions are contrapuntal and characterized by conservative harmonies and closed scales. Kauder published two works on music theory, Entwurf einer neuen Melodie- und Harmonielehre (Vienna, 1932), and Counterpoint: An Introduction to Polyphonic Composition (New York, 1960). Forced in 1938 to leave Vienna where he was a member of the Konzertverein Orchestra, he settled in New York in 1940 and spent the rest of his career composing and teaching there.

scopecontent.head: Scope Note
scopecontent.p: The Hugo Kauder Papers and Addenda includes records, holograph manuscript scores, reproduced manuscript scores, and published scores. Many of the scores reproduced by blueprint process bear holograph revisions or dynamic markings in pen or pencil, and a number of scores are inscribed to Edward E. Lowinsky and his family.

The Kauder Papers are arranged in five series: Series I: Phonograph Records; Series II: Holograph Manuscript Scores; Series III: Reproduction Manuscript Scores; Series IV: Published Music; Series V: Addenda Manuscript Scores and Essays. This collection has been assigned Codex Manuscript #1399.

did.unittitle: Series I: Phonograph Records
Sonata for English horn and Piano; and Improvisation for English Horn Alone. Boston: Night Music Recording Company, 1946. NM 105 108. Two 10" discs, four sides.
Series II: Holograph Manuscript Scores
Capriccio. [String trio]. 1927.
Preludium und Fuge. [Piano]. June 30, 1939. 2 copies with slight variations and revisions; apparently older version marked "VII"
Sonate in A für Violine und Klavier. 1939.
Prüludium und Fuge (III) [G minor, piano]. 1939.
Sonate für das Klavier, I. Satz. Christmas, 1940. Inscribed "Eduard Lowinsky herzlichst HK"
Zweite Sonate für das Klavier. Für Eduard Lowinsky. March 12, 1941.
Prüludium und Fuge. [G major, piano]. Undated.
Prüludium und Fuge. [F# major, piano]. Undated. Inscribed "Herzlichsten Gruss! HK"
Kleine Suite für Violine Bratsche und Violincell. [with separate parts]. Undated.
IV. Streichquartett, 2. Satz. Undated.
V. Streichquartett, I. Satz. Dated May 23, no year.
Konzert für Bratsche und Streichorchester. [Piano reduction with separate viola part]. Undated.
Zweite Kleine Suite für Violine und Klavier. [With separate violin part]. Undated.
Drei Kinderlieder. Undated. Inscribed "Eduard und Grete Lowinsky, für Naomi"
Series III: Reproduction Manuscript Scores

Ein neues Geigebüchlein: Sieben Sonaten für die Geige allein, Sonate für zwei Geigen, Sonate für drei Geigen. 1931. Autograph revisions in pen. Autograph manuscript: Sonate für zwei Geigen, 2. Geigenstimme für Cello eine Oktave tiefer.
Vom Leiden. [Song, words by Albert Verwey]. May 26, 1932.
Prelude, Passacaglia and Fugue for the Organ. July 27, 1935.
Gesang der Geister über den Wassern. [Song, words by Goethe]. August 16, 1937.
Sonate für Viola und Klavier. 1938. Manuscript performance markings in pencil.
Two Songs (Poems by W. B. Yeats): The Everlasting Voices; Had I the Heaven's Embroidered Cups. January 30 and May 7, 1939.
Abbitte. [Song, words by Hölderlin]. April 20, 1939. Negative photostat.
I. Sonate für das Klavier. New York, October 21, 1940.
Sonate für zwei Geigen. November 26, 1940.
Loesung. [Song, words by Rudolf Pannwitz]. May 11, 1941.Sternenmoral. [Song, words by Nietsche]. May 30, 1941. 2 copies
III. Kleine Suite. [For violin and piano; separate violin part]. July 11, 1941.
Vierte Kleine Suite für Violine und Klavier. [With separate violin part]. August 8, 1941.
Dritte Sonate. [Piano]. New York, December 20, 1941.
The Everlasting Voices. [Song, words by W. B. Yeats. A five-part version which differs markedly from the 1939 one-part version in 'Folder 21]. January 24, 1942. Two Copies
Seventh String Quartet. New York, July 30, 1942.
Toccata für das Klavier. November 3, 1942. Inscribed "Herzlichsten Gruss! 9.11.42 HK"
Sonate für zwei Violinen. 1942. Manuscript revision in pen.
Sonate für Horn und Klavier, Willem Valkenier zugeeignet. [Separate horn part]. New York, February 5, 1943. Manuscript revisions in pen and dynamic markings in pencil.
Sonatine für das Klavier. New York, February 27, 1943. Manuscript revisions in pen; six staves of manuscript revisions on cardboard.
Klavierbüchlein (The Piano Book) I. 1943. Manuscript revisions in pen. Inscribed "Herzlichen Gruss! HK"
Klavierbüchlein (The Piano Book) II. 1943. Manuscript revisions in pen.
Eighth Quartet. October 14, 1944.
Drei Choralvorspiele für die Orgel. 1944.
Trio, Erwin Bodky zugeeignet. [Violin, `cello, piano; separate parts]. May 27, 1945. Manuscript dynamic markings in pen.
Sonata for English Horn and Piano, to Mr. Louis Speyer. [Separate English horn part]. 1946. Manuscript revisions in pencil.
Serenade für Flöte Violine Viola. [Separate parts]. 1947. Manuscript revisions in pen.
Vierte Sonate für das Klavier, für Lilian Kallir. March 28, 1948. Manuscript revisions in pen on cardboard pasted over one and a half staves on p. 5.
Kleine Suite: Fünf Stücke aus dem Geigenbüchlein für Violine und Klavier. [Separate parts]. Undated, [ca. 1931?] performance markings in pencil.
Song from `Deirdre' (W. B. Yeats). [Flute, voice and harp]. Undated. Manuscript revision in pen; two copies.
Zwei Sprüche. [Songs, words by Hölderlin]. Undated. Zigeunerlied. [Song, words by Goethe]. Undated. Negative photostat.Three English Folksongs (arranged by Hugo Kauder). Undated.
Series IV: Published Music

Streichquartett C Moll (Vienna: Universal-Edition, 1922). Inscribed "Herzlichen Gruss! HK" Sieben Lieder für eine Singstimme mit Klavier-beglietung (Vienna: By the composer, 1928). Inscribed "Eduard Lowinsky und den seinen aufs herzlichste August 1939 HK"

Chorbüchlein, Erstes Heft (Vienna: Universal-Edition, 1937).Twaalf Gedichten/Zwölf Gedichte (Santpoort: C. A. Mees, 1939). Words by Albert Verwey, translated into German by Stefan George and Rudolf Pannwitz. One voice with piano.

Die Suche nach dem Traum / In Search of a Dream (Peking: Die Pappelinsel Werkstatt / The Poplar Island Press, n.d.) Words from drama, "The Return of the Soul" by T'ang Hsien-Tzu, German and English versions by Vincenz Hundhausen. For two female voices and piano. Inscribed "Eduard Lowinsky herzlichst New York, Mürz 1941 Hugo Kauder"
Series V: Addenda Manuscript Scores and Essays
"Who Goes With Fergus?" (W. B. Yeats). For two sopranos and an alto. Undated. Two copies.
"Three Canons." For soprano and alto. Undated. Eleven copies.
"Three Little Tailors." For two sopranos and an alto. Undated. Ten copies.
"Die Nachtigall." (Goethe). For flute, soprano, and alto.
"Psalm CXLVIII, 1-4." For soprano, alto, and bass.
"Musik als Zeit-und Raumkunst. Fragmente." T.D., 2 pp.
"Musiealische Bildung." T.D., 3 pp.
"Musik und Dichtung." T.D., 4 pp.
"Das Aussehmusikalische in Der Musik. Fragmente." T.D., 3 pp.
"Volkslied und Kunstlied." T.D., 2 pp.
